   17: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   18: %% @author Maxim Fedorov <maximfca@gmail.com>
   19: %% Basic process tracing profiler tests.
   20: -module(tprof_SUITE).
   21: -author("maximfca@gmail.com").
   22: 
   23: %% Test server callbacks
   24: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0,
   25:          init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   26: 
   27: %% Test cases exports
   28: -export([
   29:     call_count_ad_hoc/0, call_count_ad_hoc/1,
   30:     call_time_ad_hoc/0, call_time_ad_hoc/1,
   31:     call_memory_ad_hoc/0, call_memory_ad_hoc/1,
   32:     lists_seq_loop/1, call_memory_total/1,
   33:     sort/0, sort/1,
   34:     rootset/0, rootset/1,
   35:     set_on_spawn/0, set_on_spawn/1, seq/1,
   36:     live_trace/0, live_trace/1,
   37:     patterns/0, patterns/1, pattern_fun/1, pattern_fun/2, pattern_fun/3,
   38:     processes/0, processes/1,
   39:     server/0, server/1,
   40:     server_all/0, server_all/1,
   41:     hierarchy/0, hierarchy/1,
   42:     code_reload/0, code_reload/1,
   43:     code_load/0, code_load/1
   44: ]).
   45: 
   46: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   47: 
   48: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   49: %% COMMON TEST CALLBACK FUNCTIONS
   50: 
   51: suite() ->
   52:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 60}}].
   53: 
   54: all() ->
   55:     [call_count_ad_hoc, %% Cannot be run in parallel
   56:      {group, all}].
   57: 
   58: groups() ->
   59:     [{all, parallel(),
   60:       [call_time_ad_hoc, call_memory_ad_hoc,
   61:        call_memory_total, sort, rootset, set_on_spawn,
   62:        code_load, code_reload,
   63:        {group, default_session},
   64:        {group, custom_session}]},
   65:      {default_session,[],session()},
   66:      {custom_session,parallel(),session()}].
   67: 
   68: %% Because of scalability/performance issues in trace:info/3 we only run in parallel
   69: %% if we have a "small" amount of schedulers online.
   70: parallel() ->
   71:     [parallel || erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) < 64].
   72: 
   73: init_per_group(custom_session, Config) ->
   74:     [{session, ?MODULE} | Config];
   75: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
   76:     Config.
   77: 
   78: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
   79:     Config.
   80: 
   81: session() ->
   82:     [live_trace, patterns, processes, server, hierarchy, server_all].
   83: 
   84: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   85: %% TEST CASES
   86: 
   87: call_count_ad_hoc() ->
   88:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_count measurement"}].
   89: 
   90: call_count_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   91:     ct:capture_start(),
   92:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16]),
   93:     ct:capture_stop(),
   94:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
   95: 
   96:     %% We check that only the things profiled are lists:seq/2 and lists:seq_loop/3
   97:     %% and that the output looks good
   98:     ?assertMatch(
   99:        ["FUNCTION          CALLS  [    %]",
  100:         "lists:seq/2           1  ["++_,
  101:         "lists:seq_loop/3      5  ["++_,
  102:         "                         [100.0]"], Output),
  103: 
  104:     %% spawn examples
  105:     SpawnFun =
  106:         fun () ->
  107:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  108:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  109:        end,
  110:     %% trace subset examples
  111:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}],
  112:                                                  report => return, type => call_count}),
  113:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{all, _, _}]}]}, Profile1),
  114: 
  115:     %% timer
  116:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, {call_count, Profile2}} = tprof:profile(
  117:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), receive after Delay -> ok end end,
  118:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_count }),
  119:     ?assertMatch([{lists, seq, 2, [{_, 1, _}]},
  120:                   {lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]},
  121:                   {?MODULE, _, _, _}], lists:sort(Profile2)),
  122: 
  123:     %% timer with patterns
  124:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile3} = tprof:profile(
  125:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  126:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_count,
  127:           pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}]}),
  128:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{all, _, _}]}]}, Profile3).
  129: 
  130: call_time_ad_hoc() ->
  131:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_time measurement"}].
  132: 
  133: call_time_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  134:     ct:capture_start(),
  135:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 1000], #{type => call_time}),
  136:     ct:capture_stop(),
  137:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  138: 
  139:     %% We check that only the things profiled are lists:seq/2 and lists:seq_loop/3
  140:     ?assertMatch(
  141:        ["****** Process "++_,
  142:         "FUNCTION          CALLS  TIME"++_,
  143:         "lists:seq/2           1       "++_,
  144:         "lists:seq_loop/3    251       "++_,
  145:         "                              "++_],
  146:        Output),
  147: 
  148:     %% spawn examples
  149:     SpawnFun =
  150:         fun () ->
  151:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  152:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  153:        end,
  154:     %% trace subset examples
  155:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}],
  156:                                                  report => return, type => call_time}),
  157:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]}]}, Profile1),
  158: 
  159:     %% timer
  160:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, {call_time, Profile2}} = tprof:profile(
  161:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), receive after Delay -> ok end end,
  162:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_time }),
  163:     ?assertMatch([{lists, seq, 2, [{_, 1, _}]},
  164:                   {lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]},
  165:                   {?MODULE, _, _, _}
  166:                  ], lists:sort(Profile2)),
  167: 
  168:     %% timer with filter
  169:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile3} = tprof:profile(
  170:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  171:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_time,
  172:           pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}]}),
  173:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]}]}, Profile3).
  174: 
  175: call_memory_ad_hoc() ->
  176:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_memory measurement"}].
  177: 
  178: call_memory_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  179:     ct:capture_start(),
  180:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16], #{type => call_memory}),
  181:     ct:capture_stop(),
  182:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  183:     %% We check that only the things profiled are lists:seq/2 and lists:seq_loop/3
  184:     %% and that the output looks good
  185:     ?assertMatch(
  186:        ["****** Process "++_,
  187:         "FUNCTION          CALLS  WORDS  PER CALL  [     %]",
  188:         "lists:seq_loop/3      5     32      6.40  [100.00]",
  189:         "                            32            [ 100.0]"], Output),
  190:     %% spawn examples
  191:     SpawnFun =
  192:         fun () ->
  193:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  194:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  195:        end,
  196:     %% trace subset examples
  197:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_memory}),
  198:     ?assertMatch({call_memory, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, 64}]}]}, Profile1),
  199:     %% timer
  200:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
  201:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  202:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_memory}),
  203:     ?assertMatch({call_memory, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, 64}]}]}, Profile2).
  204: 
  205: lists_seq_loop(N) ->
  206:     [int_to_bin_twice(M) || M <- lists:seq(1, N)].
  207: 
  208: int_to_bin_twice(M) ->
  209:     B = integer_to_binary(M),
  210:     <<B/binary, B/binary>>.
  211: 
  212: %% Ensure total is not truncated,
  213: %% as per https://github.com/erlang/otp/issues/8139
  214: call_memory_total(_Config) ->
  215:     ct:capture_start(),
  216:     ok = tprof:profile(?MODULE, lists_seq_loop, [10000], #{type => call_memory}),
  217:     ct:capture_stop(),
  218:     ?assertNotMatch(nomatch, re:run(ct:capture_get(), " 15000[01] ")),
  219:     ok.
  220: 
  221: sort() ->
  222:     [{doc, "Tests sorting methods work"}].
  223: 
  224: sort(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  225:     %% sort examples
  226:     ct:capture_start(),
  227:     ok = tprof:profile(
  228:         fun () ->
  229:             Group = lists:seq(100, 120),
  230:             rand:uniform(hd(Group))
  231:         end, #{report => {process, {measurement_per_call, descending}}, type => call_memory}),
  232:     ct:capture_stop(),
  233:     Out = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  234:     %% measurement per call is 5th column
  235:     Col = 5,
  236:     Column5 = [string:to_integer(lists:nth(Col, Lexemes)) || Ln <- Out,
  237:         length(Lexemes = string:lexemes(Ln, " ")) >= Col],
  238:     WPC = [Words || {Words, []} <- Column5],
  239:     %% ensure descending sort
  240:     ?assertEqual(lists:reverse(lists:sort(WPC)), WPC).
  241: 
  242: rootset() ->
  243:     [{doc, "Tests rootset of processes supplied to ad-hoc profiler"}].
  244: 
  245: rootset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  246:     TestCase = random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  247:     {ok, Scope} = pg:start_link(TestCase),
  248:     Fun = fun () -> ok = pg:join(TestCase, lists:seq(1, 2), self()) end,
  249:     %% rootset tests
  250:     {ok, Profile} = tprof:profile(Fun, #{rootset => [TestCase], report => return, type => call_memory}),
  251:     TwoProcs = tprof:inspect(Profile),
  252:     ?assertEqual(2, maps:size(TwoProcs)), %% must be pg and "profiled process"
  253:     %% now trace all processes, existing and new
  254:     {ok, ProfAll} = tprof:profile(Fun, #{rootset => all, report => return, type => call_memory}),
  255:     %% at least tprof, pg2 and new profiled processes are traced
  256:     ?assert(map_size(tprof:inspect(ProfAll)) >= 3),
  257:     gen_server:stop(Scope).
  258: 
  259: set_on_spawn() ->
  260:     [{doc, "Tests tprof running with extra spawned processes"}].
  261: 
  262: set_on_spawn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  263:     %% profile a function that spawns additional process
  264:     {done, Profile} = tprof:profile(
  265:         fun () ->
  266:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  267:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  268:         end, #{report => return, set_on_spawn => false, type => call_memory}),
  269:     ct:log("~p",[Profile]),
  270:     {done, ProfileMFA} = tprof:profile(?MODULE, seq, [32],
  271:                                        #{report => return,
  272:                                          set_on_spawn => false,
  273:                                          type => call_memory}),
  274: 
  275:     ct:log("~p",[ProfileMFA]),
  276:     %% check totals
  277:     #{all := {call_memory, _G1, TotalProfile}} = tprof:inspect(Profile, total, measurement),
  278:     #{all := {call_memory, _G2, TotalProfileMFA}} = tprof:inspect(ProfileMFA, total, measurement),
  279:     %% only 1 process must be there
  280:     ?assertEqual(1, maps:size(tprof:inspect(Profile)), {set_on_spawn, Profile}),
  281: 
  282:     DownMsgSz =
  283:         case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  284:             8 -> 9;
  285:             4 -> 10
  286:         end,
  287:     DownMsgSzFl = DownMsgSz * 1.0,
  288:     %% check per-process stats
  289:     ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {_, 0}, 1, DownMsgSz, DownMsgSzFl, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfile)),
  290: 
  291:     %% MFA version takes 3 more words (fun + one environment variable). The
  292:     %% memory of the 'DOWN' message is a bit racy, so sometimes it will be
  293:     %% there or not.
  294:     MfaSz = 3,
  295:     ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {seq, 1}, 1, Sz, SzAvg, _}
  296:                  when Sz =:= (DownMsgSz + MfaSz) andalso SzAvg == (DownMsgSz + MfaSz);
  297:                       Sz =:= MfaSz andalso SzAvg == MfaSz,
  298:                       lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfileMFA)).
  299: 
  300: seq(Max) ->
  301:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, Max) end),
  302:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end.
  303: 
  304: live_trace() ->
  305:     [{doc, "Tests memory tracing for pre-existing processes"}].
  306: 
  307: live_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  308:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{type => call_memory}),
  309:     Pid = spawn_link(
  310:         fun () ->
  311:             receive
  312:                 {From, C} ->
  313:                     [lists:seq(1, 2) || _ <- lists:seq(1, C)],
  314:                     From ! {self(), done}
  315:             end
  316:         end),
  317:     _ = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, '_', '_'),
  318:     1 = enable_trace(Config, Srv, Pid),
  319:     Pid ! {self(), 12},
  320:     receive {Pid, done} -> ok end,
  321:     catch disable_trace(Config, Srv, Pid),
  322:     Profile = collect(Config, Srv),
  323:     ProcInspected = tprof:inspect(Profile),
  324:     %% white box check: list comprehension with 1-arity, and 100% allocation
  325:     %% tprof:format(user, ProcInspected),
  326:     #{Pid := {call_memory, 48, [{?MODULE, {_LC, 1}, 13, 48, _, 100.0}]}} = ProcInspected,
  327:     stop(Config, Srv).
  328: 
  329: patterns() ->
  330:     [{doc, "Tests pattern enable/disable correctness"}].
  331: 
  332: patterns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  333:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{type => call_memory}),
  334:     %% test errors
  335:     ?assertEqual({error, {not_traced, pg, get_members, '_'}}, clear_pattern(Config, Srv, pg, get_members, '_')),
  336:     ?assertEqual({error, {trace_pattern, ?MODULE, seq, 2}}, set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, seq, 2)),
  337:     %% successful patterns
  338:     1 = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, seq, 1),
  339:     3 = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, pattern_fun, '_'),
  340:     1 = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, pattern_fun, 2),
  341:     Expected = [{pattern_fun, 1}, {pattern_fun, 3}, {seq, 1}],
  342:     ?assertEqual(#{?MODULE => Expected}, get_trace_map(Config, Srv)),
  343:     %% verify tracing flags
  344:     verify_trace(Srv, [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Expected], [{?MODULE, pattern_fun, 2}]),
  345:     %% trace the entire ?MODULE module, and then exclude pattern_fun/1,2,3 and seq/1
  346:     _ = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, '_', '_'),
  347:     3 = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, pattern_fun, '_'),
  348:     1 = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, seq, 1),
  349:     Cleared = [{pattern_fun, 1}, {pattern_fun, 2}, {pattern_fun, 3}, {seq, 1}],
  350:     Traced = ?MODULE:module_info(functions) -- Cleared,
  351:     verify_trace(Srv, [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Traced], [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Cleared]),
  352:     %% clear all, which clears lists too
  353:     _ = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, '_', '_', '_'),
  354:     verify_trace(Srv, [], [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Traced ++ Cleared]),
  355:     ?assertEqual(#{}, get_trace_map(Config, Srv)),
  356: 
  357:     %% Trace the entire node then exclude pattern_fun/1,2,3 and seq/1
  358:     _ = set_pattern(Config, Srv, '_', '_', '_'),
  359:     ?assertEqual(all, get_trace_map(Config, Srv)),
  360: 
  361:     stop(Config, Srv).
  362: 
  363: verify_trace(Srv, On, Off) ->
  364:     [?assertEqual({call_memory, []}, trace:info(tprof:get_session(Srv),MFA, call_memory)) || MFA <- On],
  365:     [?assertEqual({call_memory, false}, trace:info(tprof:get_session(Srv),MFA, call_memory)) || MFA <- Off].
  366: 
  367: pattern_fun(Any) -> Any.
  368: pattern_fun(Any, Any2) -> {Any, Any2}.
  369: pattern_fun(Any, Any2, Any3) -> {Any, Any2, Any3}.
  370: 
  371: processes() ->
  372:     [{doc, "Tests that process management for enabling/disabling traces works"}].
  373: 
  374: processes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  375: 
  376:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config),
  377: 
  378:     Pid = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  379:     Pid2 = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  380:     Name = random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  381:     register(Name, Pid2),
  382:     %% test a mix of pids/registered processes/single PID calls
  383:     ?assertEqual(2, enable_trace(Config, Srv, [Pid, Name])),
  384:     ?assertEqual(0, disable_trace(Config, Srv, '$sure_not_exist')),
  385:     ?assertEqual({1, ['$sure_not_exist']}, enable_trace(Config, Srv, [Pid, '$sure_not_exist'])),
  386:     ok = gen:stop(Pid),
  387:     ok = gen:stop(Name),
  388: 
  389:     stop(Config, Srv).
  390: 
  391: server() ->
  392:     [{doc, "Tests for gen_server-based API"}].
  393: 
  394: server(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  395:     Name = random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  396: 
  397:     %% start an extra pg scope - we'll trace it during profiling
  398:     {ok, Scope} = pg:start_link(Name),
  399:     %% simulate existing process
  400:     Pid = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  401:     %% start the profiler
  402:     {ok, _Srv} = tprof:start_link(#{type => call_memory}),
  403:     %% test that ad-hoc profile can be run
  404:     ?assertEqual(ok, tprof:profile(fun() -> lists:seq(1,10) end)),
  405:     %% test live trace
  406:     1 = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, dispatch, '_'),
  407:     _ = tprof:set_pattern(pg, '_', '_'),
  408:     %% watch for pg traces and for our process
  409:     2 = tprof:enable_trace([Pid, Name]),
  410:     %% run the traced operation
  411:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [Name, group, Pid]}),
  412:     %% collect profile (can save it to a file for later analysis)
  413:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  414:     %% must not be empty, and must contain 3-words dispatch from this module,
  415:     %%  and at least something from pg in two processes
  416:     ?assertNotEqual([], FirstProfile),
  417:     ?assertEqual({?MODULE, dispatch, 2, [{Pid, 1, 3}]}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, FirstProfile)),
  418:     ?assertMatch({pg, handle_call, 3, [{Scope, _, _}]}, lists:keyfind(handle_call, 2, FirstProfile)),
  419:     ?assertMatch({pg, join, 3, [{Pid, _, _}]}, lists:keyfind(join, 2, FirstProfile)),
  420:     %% pause tracing
  421:     ok = tprof:pause(),
  422:     %% ensure paused by running more code but keeping the trace
  423:     %% ensure collection still returns the previous result
  424:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [Name, group, Pid]}),
  425:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  426:     %% continue, ensure new results are collected
  427:     ok = tprof:continue(),
  428:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, leave, [Name, group, [Pid, Pid]]}),
  429:     ?assertNotEqual({call_memory, FirstProfile}, tprof:collect()),
  430:     %% restart all counters from zero and ensure that we again collect the original data
  431:     ok = tprof:restart(),
  432:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [Name, group, Pid]}),
  433:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  434: 
  435:     %% test ad-hoc profiling can be done while running server-aided
  436:     %% for that, profiler should have very specific pattern
  437:     {_, AdHoc} = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 32], #{registered => false, pattern => {lists, '_', '_'},
  438:         report => return, type => call_memory}),
  439:     %% check totals: must be 64 words allocated by a single lists:seq_loop
  440:     ?assertMatch(#{all := {call_memory, 64, [{lists, _, _, 64, _, _}]}},
  441:                  tprof:inspect(AdHoc, total, measurement)),
  442:     %% verify that server-aided version still works
  443:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  444:     ok = tprof:stop(),
  445:     ok = gen_server:stop(Scope),
  446:     ok = gen:stop(Pid).
  447: 
  448: server_all() ->
  449:     [{doc, "Test that tprof in server mode profiling all works"}].
  450: 
  451: server_all(Config) ->
  452: 
  453:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{ type => call_time }),
  454: 
  455:     enable_trace(Config, Srv, self()),
  456:     set_pattern(Config, Srv, lists, seq, 2),
  457: 
  458:     %% Doing pause, reset and continue in tprof used to crash
  459:     lists:seq(1,100),
  460: 
  461:     ok = pause(Config, Srv),
  462: 
  463:     {call_time, Profile1} = collect(Config, Srv),
  464:     {value, {lists, seq, 2, [{_, 1, _}]}} =
  465:         lists:search(fun({M,F,A,_}) -> M =:= lists andalso F =:= seq andalso A =:= 2 end, Profile1),
  466: 
  467:     ok = restart(Config, Srv),
  468: 
  469:     lists:seq(1,100),
  470: 
  471:     {call_time, Profile2} = collect(Config, Srv),
  472:     {value, {lists, seq, 2, [{_, 1, _}]}} =
  473:         lists:search(fun({M,F,A,_}) -> M =:= lists andalso F =:= seq andalso A =:= 2 end, Profile2),
  474: 
  475:     ok = pause(Config, Srv),
  476:     ok = continue(Config, Srv),
  477: 
  478:     lists:seq(1,100),
  479: 
  480:     {call_time, Profile3} = collect(Config, Srv),
  481:     {value, {lists, seq, 2, [{_, 1, _}]}} =
  482:         lists:search(fun({M,F,A,_}) -> M =:= lists andalso F =:= seq andalso A =:= 2 end, Profile3),
  483: 
  484:     stop(Config, Srv),
  485:     
  486:     ok.
  487: 
  488: %% nano-gen-server purely for tracing
  489: spawn_loop() ->
  490:     receive
  491:         {'$gen_call', From, Call} ->
  492:             dispatch(Call, From),
  493:             spawn_loop();
  494:         {system, From, {terminate,normal}} ->
  495:             gen:reply(From, ok)
  496:     end.
  497: 
  498: dispatch({spawn_link, Fun}, From) ->
  499:     gen:reply(From, erlang:spawn_link(Fun));
  500: dispatch({apply, M, F, A}, From) ->
  501:     gen:reply(From, erlang:apply(M, F, A)).
  502: 
  503: hierarchy() ->
  504:     [{doc, "Tests tracing for process hierarchy"}].
  505: 
  506: hierarchy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  507:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{type => call_memory}),
  508:     Traced = case enable_trace(Config, Srv, {all_children, kernel_sup}, #{ set_on_spawn => false }) of
  509:                  {T, _} -> T;
  510:                  T -> T
  511:              end,
  512:     ?assert(Traced > 5),
  513:     ?assert(set_pattern(Config, Srv, code_server, '_', '_') > 5),
  514:     _ = code:get_path(), %% makes a call to code_server
  515:     %% disabling all processes tracing should return more than "children of"
  516:     Disabled = disable_trace(Config, Srv, all),
  517:     ct:log("~p",[{Disabled, Traced}]),
  518:     ?assert(Disabled > Traced),
  519:     {call_memory, Profile} = collect(Config, Srv),
  520:     stop(Config, Srv),
  521:     ?assertNotEqual(false, lists:keyfind(handle_call, 2, Profile)).
  522: 
  523: code_reload() ->
  524:     [{doc, "Tests that collection does not fail for a hot-code-reloaded module"}].
  525: 
  526: code_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  527:     {_, {call_memory, Sample}} = tprof:profile(
  528:                                    fun () -> msacc:start(100), code:load_file(msacc) end,
  529:                                    #{report => return, type => call_memory}),
  530:     %% don't care about actual returned values, but do care that profile/2 does not crash
  531:     ?assertNotEqual([], Sample).
  532: 
  533: code_load() ->
  534:     [{doc, "Tests profiling works for modules loaded during profiling"}].
  535: 
  536: code_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  537:     code:purge(sofs),
  538:     code:delete(sofs),
  539:     {_, {call_memory, Sample}} =
  540:         tprof:profile(fun () -> sofs:relation([{b,1},{c,2},{c,3}]) end,
  541:                       #{report => return, type => call_memory}),
  542:     ?assertNotEqual(false, lists:keyfind(sofs, 1, Sample)).
  543: 
  544: -define(SESSION(A, B),
  545:         case proplists:get_value(session, Config) of
  546:             undefined ->
  547:                 A;
  548:             _Session ->
  549:                 B
  550:         end).
  551: 
  552: start_link(Config) ->
  553:     ?SESSION(
  554:        tprof:start_link(),
  555:        tprof:start_link(#{ session => _Session })).
  556: 
  557: start_link(Config, Opts) ->
  558:     ?SESSION(
  559:        tprof:start_link(Opts),
  560:        tprof:start_link(Opts#{ session => _Session })).
  561: 
  562: set_pattern(Config, Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg) ->
  563:     ?SESSION(
  564:        tprof:set_pattern(Mod, Fun, Arg),
  565:        tprof:set_pattern(Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg)
  566:       ).
  567: 
  568: clear_pattern(Config, Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg) ->
  569:     ?SESSION(
  570:        tprof:clear_pattern(Mod, Fun, Arg),
  571:        tprof:clear_pattern(Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg)
  572:       ).
  573: 
  574: enable_trace(Config, Srv, Spec) ->
  575:     ?SESSION(
  576:        tprof:enable_trace(Spec),
  577:        tprof:enable_trace(Srv, Spec, [])
  578:       ).
  579: 
  580: enable_trace(Config, Srv, Spec, Opts) ->
  581:     ?SESSION(
  582:        tprof:enable_trace(Spec, Opts),
  583:        tprof:enable_trace(Srv, Spec, Opts)
  584:       ).
  585: 
  586: disable_trace(Config, Srv, Spec) ->
  587:     ?SESSION(
  588:        tprof:disable_trace(Spec),
  589:        tprof:disable_trace(Srv, Spec, [])
  590:       ).
  591: 
  592: collect(Config, Srv) ->
  593:     ?SESSION(
  594:        tprof:collect(),
  595:        tprof:collect(Srv)
  596:       ).
  597: 
  598: pause(Config, Srv) ->
  599:     ?SESSION(
  600:        tprof:pause(),
  601:        tprof:pause(Srv)
  602:       ).
  603: 
  604: restart(Config, Srv) ->
  605:     ?SESSION(
  606:        tprof:restart(),
  607:        tprof:restart(Srv)
  608:       ).
  609: 
  610: continue(Config, Srv) ->
  611:     ?SESSION(
  612:        tprof:continue(),
  613:        tprof:continue(Srv)
  614:       ).
  615: 
  616: get_trace_map(Config, Srv) ->
  617:     ?SESSION(
  618:        tprof:get_trace_map(),
  619:        tprof:get_trace_map(Srv)
  620:       ).
  621: 
  622: stop(Config, Srv) ->
  623:     ?SESSION(
  624:        tprof:stop(),
  625:        tprof:stop(Srv)
  626:       ).
  627: 
  628: random_name(Prefix) ->
  629:     list_to_atom(atom_to_list(Prefix) ++ "__" ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer())).
  630:
